pros: The staff is nice! The building is beautiful and there is parking underground for event planners. There is always a reception or educational event going on which makes the job fun.
cons: The events are repetitive. The job could be hybrid for event planners.

pros: Good people, family-like culture, flexible schedule, autonomy, offer competitive salaries and good benefit packages
cons: Small school, so budget is lean; lack of racial diversity

pros: The mission of the school is very good.  The faculty are talented and the alumni are driven.
cons: Since its founding in the early '90's, the school has never been financially stable.  The founder/president prefers to spend more time on running the academic side than on raising an endowment that would be adequate to support the school.  The board has never been able to help with this either.  Very few raises have ever been given and turnover of employees at all levels have been constant over the years.  This much turnover is not beneficial for a school.  This has contributed much to the continual low employee morale.

pros:
- EVP Noah Rudolph is an excellent leader on the administrative side of the school.  
- Staff is friendly and works well together.  Many choose to go above and beyond their job description to help the school and its mission. 
- IWP has a work environment in which it is easy to take initiative with new projects and make them happen. 
- Students and alumni of the school are driven and great to work with.
cons: - Not a huge budget to work with, which is probably normal for a growing school.

job_title: Former Member of Senior Management in Washington, DC
pros: No serious oversight; no performance reviews; no monitoring of hours or absences; flex-time.
cons: No leadership from the top, instead much micro-managing. No trust in the employees. No desire to hire serious, experienced professionals. No telling the truth to power without severe, career-jeopardizing repercussions. No secure financial base; instead, declining finances. Long-standing accreditation problems threaten the school's continued viability.

pros: People are pleasant to one another, work stream is steady and manageable.  Top level government officials visit as well as former ones, so good networking opportunities.  Great holiday parties, and health care benefits.
cons: The two buildings are a bit small for the current operations and future growth.  If the IWP wishes to grow it needs to consider moving to a new location in the DMV area.

job_title: Chief Financial Officer in Washington, DC
pros: IWP has a great mission!  The organization is very family oriented and I feel serves its students well.  All employees work well together and feel like they are part of a team.  Everyone is heard and their opinions matter!  The management staff has an open door policy and welcomes everyone's view!
cons: As with all non-profits and small organizations, budget remains tight.

review_title: Great opportunities if you take advantage
pros:
- Great mission, programs and connections throughout the D.C. community, all throughout the international affairs and government community
- Great opportunities professionally and through education (free/reduced cost courses)
- Close knit community and family
cons:
- Some shifts with upper management over the years, but not unique to up and coming businesses/schools
- Limited budget (also not unique)
- Small spaces, but it has slowly begun expanding

pros: Interesting intellectual field and many opportunities to meet smart people
cons: Clunky admin and management could be better
